blog.name: you-knew-what-it-was
blog.title: Courtney • Aussie Swiftie • Melbourne
blog.description: 26 // Lily & Alex // Absolute Style Stan // Hoping to hug Taylor this era! // one time, Taylor reblogged a smart ass comment of mine and I was shaken to my core. It was awesome. // Insta: courtfrancisg

summary: My story with Taylor began in 2006
body:
My story with Taylor began in 2006

When I heard Tim McGraw for the first time. It was burned in my mind and I listened to her album over and over.

My story continued in 2008.

Fearless was released. My dad got cancer. The Best Day became my anthem. I cried a lot. In 2009 the tour hit Australia and I cried again as I saw her on stage a mere 3 metres in front of me.

In 2010, it got more important.

I was in my final year of high school. My dad passed away. I was in my final exams. And Speak Now was released. She wrote that on her own. She was so strong and incredible. I saw myself in her, and resilience was instilled into me as I worked to succeed in everything I did.

In 2012 I met my best friend.

Kathy and I grew to know each other over her past albums, we went to Speak Now in January, and were thrilled when she released Red. All Too Well devastated us both and we cried and rode in our cars on hot summer nights singing all her songs.

In 2014 Kathy and I were sitting at uni together

Shake It Off was just released, and we sat in excitement as we watched her new video, enthralled in the bop that it was. 1989 came, I got my first full time adult job, I listened to the album every day on my train ride to the city, and the tour came to Melbourne in 2015. We sewed fairy lights into our shirts so we would shine just for her.

In 2017 I was on top of Mount Hotham

About to board a chairlift, I stopped to listen to her newest song. After a hiatus that was hard but reasonable. She came back stronger than ever and I knew I’d chosen the right person. To help me be strong. To help me find comfort and happiness after the hard times in my life. I went down that mountain pumping LWYMMD and I knew I was living.

I love you Taylor.

blog.name: joeandtaylorfanfiction
blog.title: Fanfiction Collection
blog.description: Hey Guys! This page is a collection of all Joe and Taylor fanfiction! (These stories are not mine) Please feel free to submit a post or ask me to reblog, my inbox is always open!   One shots Series Mature Imagine's Fanfic Festival

title: Confessions - part two (Submission)
body:
Gigi opened her mouth to say something but no sound came out. Taylor kept staring at her and she could feel herself getting warmer on the face which meant she was getting progressively redder. It took a lot of determination from her part not to bury her head in one of the couch’s pillows.
“You slept with him…” Gigi finally said, “as in, you two fell asleep on the couch together or something?” She asked very slowly, looking incredibly confused and unsure.
Taylor looked at her incredulously and said “No Gigi, I slept with him as in we fucked on the living room floor.”
They stared at each other for a few seconds, Taylor looking annoyed and Gigi looking the definition of speechless, until all of a sudden Gigi started laughing.
“Oh my God, what the hell, this is a serious matter!” Taylor exclaimed.
“Oh God, I’m sorry” Gigi started in between laughter, “but I really wasn’t expecting you to say that” she said as she continued laughing.
“Will you stop?” Taylor asked her, still annoyed.
“Okay, I’m okay” Gigi told her while trying to calm her breathing, “I’m sorry, I didn’t mean to laugh, I just really wasn’t expecting it. I was kind of shocked. I’m fine now. Oh God.” Gigi took a deep breath. “Okay, so, if I got this straight, you were just going to be friends but got drunk one night and had sex. Drunk sex. And now you’re worried it might get awkward?”
“Oh God” Taylor groaned. “Not exactly…”
“Taylor” Gigi said, trying really hard not to roll her eyes. “I’m trying to help, I really am, so will you please just tell me what it is that I still don’t know?”
“I’m sorry, it’s just, I’m so confused…”
“I can see that, trust me. Just tell me the rest.”
“Okay… So, we slept together that night, right? And when I woke up the next morning I really thought it was going to be awkward, especially because we were a bit tipsy, but it wasn’t. It was so… normal? I guess. And we said ‘okay, this happened, we can still be friends, we’re not letting it ruin everything’ and we went on as usual” she paused her ramble and Gigi tilted her head at her so she would continue, “until it happened again. And we definitely weren’t drunk the second time.”
Gigi’s eyes went wide, “Ohhh my God… so you-“
“No wait, just let me finish it” Taylor interrupted. “It happened a third time, and then a fourth, and we decided why not have a bit of fun, you know, and so we said we’d still be friends and if it happened that we had sex because we both wanted to, then, well, it did. But now I really like him, and I don’t know how to tell him without messing it all up because we basically said we’d only have casual sexy while being friends” she finished and took a deep breath. She kind of forgot to breathe for a second there.
“Okay…” Gigi said, “Okay, we’ll find a solution, yeah? It’ll be okay. Come here” she asked as she opened her arms.
Taylor mover into Gigi’s direction not having to worry about Olivia, who had moved from her lap a couple of minutes ago.
“I’ve been so stressed about this, Gi” Taylor said into her her friends’s neck while they hugged.
“Why didn’t you tell me earlier? I would have tried to help you.”
“I didn’t really tell anyone… it felt so good having someone just mine, you know. With no outside pressure.”
“Well, now I know and we’ll figure something out, okay?”
“Yeah… thanks Gi.”
“I don’t want you to thank me” she said as she pulled back from the hug to look at Taylor. “I want you to tell me everything about him. He was really nice when I met him, a perfect gentleman, great jokes, great hair.”
Taylor started laughing, “He really does have great hair, doesn’t he? It’s so soft.”
Gigi smirked at her, “Well I don’t know if it’s soft or not, only that it looked really good.”
Taylor bit her lip, “Yeah…” and she couldn’t help it, she actually giggled. “It’s really silky…”
“I bet” her friend laughed. “So, he plays scrabble?” Gigi asked her, wanting to hear more about the guy who had one of her best friends giggling like a school girl. She could feel Taylor’s stress about the situation so she thought she probably needed to focus on the good things for a minute. Also she definitely needed some info to start planning her argument on this new subject. Gigi smirked.
“Oh my God, yes!” Gigi focused on Taylor again. If there was something that got this girl excited was scrabble. And cats, of course. “He knows all these uncommon words people I usually play with don’t, and he’s good with strategy too. Did you know he studied literature in college? Or uni, like he calls it. Like, we literally have conversations for hours, it’s amazing.”
“I’m so happy for you, Taylor, you deserve this.” Gigi told her, smiling softly. “So” she continued, a smirk growing on her face, “are you going to spill, or what?”
Taylor stared at her. “On what?” 
“On the sex, Taylor” Gigi answered excitedly.
Taylor groaned, starting to blush again. She was blushing an awful lot for just one afternoon. “No, I’m not talking about that, no way.”
“Aw, come on, baby, nothing too explicit.” Gigi teased.
“Please” Taylor started, not look looking her friend in the eye. “Please, don’t call me that…”
The other girl looked startled for a second but then smirked again. “Aw, does Joe call you ‘baaaby’” she teased, prolonging the word.
“Shut up, please.” Taylor asked, cringing a bit. Just a bit.
“Fine, just tell me if the sex’s good and we’ll talk about something else.”
Taylor didn’t say anything for a few seconds and then just started talking really fast. “The sex is really good, like, ridiculously good, amazing really, okay, do you want to go bake some cookies?”
Gigi had started laughing but had to get up because Taylor was already going to the kitchen, still she managed to say “Good for you, baby. Oh, wait, I can’t call you that anymore” she kept laughing as Taylor shot her a dirty look over the shoulder.
A couple of hours later, they had chocolate chip cookies baking in the oven and were putting away the dishes from an early dinner because Gigi had to get up early the next day for a photo shoot.
“So, I have to go to bed early tonight but what are you going to do?” She asked Taylor.
“Nothing much, really” Taylor answered while wiping the counter, “I’ll probably binge some ‘Friends’ or something…”
“Well, you do have all these cookies to eat.” 
“No way, you’re taking half of them with you.”
“What will I do with half of all of those?”
“What will I do with all of them? You’re taking half.”
“But you might have guests” Gigi smirked at the other girl. “You’ll have to feed your guests.”
Taylor narrowed her eyes at her. “I’m not having guests, you’re taking half the cookies with you and this conversation is over.”
“Touchy” her friend murmured, but Taylor pretended not to listen. “I think these are ready, Taylor” she said louder.
Taylor looked over at the oven. “Yeah, I’ll put them in a container for you, be careful with it because they’re hot.”
“Yes, mom.”
Taylor rolled her eyes as she started putting the cookies in a plastic container and then in a bag.
“There you go, have fun tomorrow.”
“Thank you, have fun binging ‘Friends’. Talk to you tomorrow?” Gigi asked as they hugged.
“Yeah, goodnight.”
“Night, Taylor.”
Taylor closed the door and noticed Meredith chilling on the carpet. “Shall we go to bed too?” She asked as she bent down to pick up the cat. “Let’s take some cookies up and watch ‘Friends’. I’ll bring some treats for you and Olivia too” she told Meredith as she went back to the kitchen. She put the cat down and grabbed a plate with some cookies, grabbed a bag of cat treats and a bottle of water.
“Come on, Mere. Where’s Dibbles, hm? Is she upstairs already?” She asked the cat as she left the kitchen.
And Olivia was, indeed, upstairs, having a nap in the middle of Taylor’s bed. “Sometimes I wonder how the two of you can sleep so much… it’s not like you have reasons to be tired, you literally do nothing all day.” Taylor said out loud while putting the things she had brought upstairs on top of her bedside table.
After changing to a fresh pair of cat pyjamas and turning on the TV, she turned off the lights and lied under the covers while the cats cuddled together on the other pillow. 
She had been watching TV for a while when she heard a buzz. She looked at her bedside table and noticed a new message on her phone’s screen. She picked it up, her heart instantly picking up the pace once she saw who it was from.
‘Hey Taylor :) where you at?’
-
(Hi! Like you might have just noticed from that last sentence, this whole thing was first inspired by ‘Delicate’, but I kind of wanted to add some background context. Hope you like it, part three should be here tomorrow)

reblog.comment:
Gigi opened her mouth to say something but no sound came out. Taylor kept staring at her and she could feel herself getting warmer on the face which meant she was getting progressively redder. It took a lot of determination from her part not to bury her head in one of the couch’s pillows.
“You slept with him…” Gigi finally said, “as in, you two fell asleep on the couch together or something?” She asked very slowly, looking incredibly confused and unsure.
Taylor looked at her incredulously and said “No Gigi, I slept with him as in we fucked on the living room floor.”
They stared at each other for a few seconds, Taylor looking annoyed and Gigi looking the definition of speechless, until all of a sudden Gigi started laughing.
“Oh my God, what the hell, this is a serious matter!” Taylor exclaimed.
“Oh God, I’m sorry” Gigi started in between laughter, “but I really wasn’t expecting you to say that” she said as she continued laughing.
“Will you stop?” Taylor asked her, still annoyed.
“Okay, I’m okay” Gigi told her while trying to calm her breathing, “I’m sorry, I didn’t mean to laugh, I just really wasn’t expecting it. I was kind of shocked. I’m fine now. Oh God.” Gigi took a deep breath. “Okay, so, if I got this straight, you were just going to be friends but got drunk one night and had sex. Drunk sex. And now you’re worried it might get awkward?”
“Oh God” Taylor groaned. “Not exactly…”
“Taylor” Gigi said, trying really hard not to roll her eyes. “I’m trying to help, I really am, so will you please just tell me what it is that I still don’t know?”
“I’m sorry, it’s just, I’m so confused…”
“I can see that, trust me. Just tell me the rest.”
“Okay… So, we slept together that night, right? And when I woke up the next morning I really thought it was going to be awkward, especially because we were a bit tipsy, but it wasn’t. It was so… normal? I guess. And we said ‘okay, this happened, we can still be friends, we’re not letting it ruin everything’ and we went on as usual” she paused her ramble and Gigi tilted her head at her so she would continue, “until it happened again. And we definitely weren’t drunk the second time.”
Gigi’s eyes went wide, “Ohhh my God… so you-“
“No wait, just let me finish it” Taylor interrupted. “It happened a third time, and then a fourth, and we decided why not have a bit of fun, you know, and so we said we’d still be friends and if it happened that we had sex because we both wanted to, then, well, it did. But now I really like him, and I don’t know how to tell him without messing it all up because we basically said we’d only have casual sexy while being friends” she finished and took a deep breath. She kind of forgot to breathe for a second there.
“Okay…” Gigi said, “Okay, we’ll find a solution, yeah? It’ll be okay. Come here” she asked as she opened her arms.
Taylor mover into Gigi’s direction not having to worry about Olivia, who had moved from her lap a couple of minutes ago.
“I’ve been so stressed about this, Gi” Taylor said into her her friends’s neck while they hugged.
“Why didn’t you tell me earlier? I would have tried to help you.”
“I didn’t really tell anyone… it felt so good having someone just mine, you know. With no outside pressure.”
“Well, now I know and we’ll figure something out, okay?”
“Yeah… thanks Gi.”
“I don’t want you to thank me” she said as she pulled back from the hug to look at Taylor. “I want you to tell me everything about him. He was really nice when I met him, a perfect gentleman, great jokes, great hair.”
Taylor started laughing, “He really does have great hair, doesn’t he? It’s so soft.”
Gigi smirked at her, “Well I don’t know if it’s soft or not, only that it looked really good.”
Taylor bit her lip, “Yeah…” and she couldn’t help it, she actually giggled. “It’s really silky…”
“I bet” her friend laughed. “So, he plays scrabble?” Gigi asked her, wanting to hear more about the guy who had one of her best friends giggling like a school girl. She could feel Taylor’s stress about the situation so she thought she probably needed to focus on the good things for a minute. Also she definitely needed some info to start planning her argument on this new subject. Gigi smirked.
“Oh my God, yes!” Gigi focused on Taylor again. If there was something that got this girl excited was scrabble. And cats, of course. “He knows all these uncommon words people I usually play with don’t, and he’s good with strategy too. Did you know he studied literature in college? Or uni, like he calls it. Like, we literally have conversations for hours, it’s amazing.”
“I’m so happy for you, Taylor, you deserve this.” Gigi told her, smiling softly. “So” she continued, a smirk growing on her face, “are you going to spill, or what?”
Taylor stared at her. “On what?” 
“On the sex, Taylor” Gigi answered excitedly.
Taylor groaned, starting to blush again. She was blushing an awful lot for just one afternoon. “No, I’m not talking about that, no way.”
“Aw, come on, baby, nothing too explicit.” Gigi teased.
“Please” Taylor started, not look looking her friend in the eye. “Please, don’t call me that…”
The other girl looked startled for a second but then smirked again. “Aw, does Joe call you ‘baaaby’” she teased, prolonging the word.
“Shut up, please.” Taylor asked, cringing a bit. Just a bit.
“Fine, just tell me if the sex’s good and we’ll talk about something else.”
Taylor didn’t say anything for a few seconds and then just started talking really fast. “The sex is really good, like, ridiculously good, amazing really, okay, do you want to go bake some cookies?”
Gigi had started laughing but had to get up because Taylor was already going to the kitchen, still she managed to say “Good for you, baby. Oh, wait, I can’t call you that anymore” she kept laughing as Taylor shot her a dirty look over the shoulder.
A couple of hours later, they had chocolate chip cookies baking in the oven and were putting away the dishes from an early dinner because Gigi had to get up early the next day for a photo shoot.
“So, I have to go to bed early tonight but what are you going to do?” She asked Taylor.
“Nothing much, really” Taylor answered while wiping the counter, “I’ll probably binge some ‘Friends’ or something…”
“Well, you do have all these cookies to eat.” 
“No way, you’re taking half of them with you.”
“What will I do with half of all of those?”
“What will I do with all of them? You’re taking half.”
“But you might have guests” Gigi smirked at the other girl. “You’ll have to feed your guests.”
Taylor narrowed her eyes at her. “I’m not having guests, you’re taking half the cookies with you and this conversation is over.”
“Touchy” her friend murmured, but Taylor pretended not to listen. “I think these are ready, Taylor” she said louder.
Taylor looked over at the oven. “Yeah, I’ll put them in a container for you, be careful with it because they’re hot.”
“Yes, mom.”
Taylor rolled her eyes as she started putting the cookies in a plastic container and then in a bag.
“There you go, have fun tomorrow.”
“Thank you, have fun binging ‘Friends’. Talk to you tomorrow?” Gigi asked as they hugged.
“Yeah, goodnight.”
“Night, Taylor.”
Taylor closed the door and noticed Meredith chilling on the carpet. “Shall we go to bed too?” She asked as she bent down to pick up the cat. “Let’s take some cookies up and watch ‘Friends’. I’ll bring some treats for you and Olivia too” she told Meredith as she went back to the kitchen. She put the cat down and grabbed a plate with some cookies, grabbed a bag of cat treats and a bottle of water.
“Come on, Mere. Where’s Dibbles, hm? Is she upstairs already?” She asked the cat as she left the kitchen.
And Olivia was, indeed, upstairs, having a nap in the middle of Taylor’s bed. “Sometimes I wonder how the two of you can sleep so much… it’s not like you have reasons to be tired, you literally do nothing all day.” Taylor said out loud while putting the things she had brought upstairs on top of her bedside table.
After changing to a fresh pair of cat pyjamas and turning on the TV, she turned off the lights and lied under the covers while the cats cuddled together on the other pillow. 
She had been watching TV for a while when she heard a buzz. She looked at her bedside table and noticed a new message on her phone’s screen. She picked it up, her heart instantly picking up the pace once she saw who it was from.
‘Hey Taylor :) where you at?’
-
(Hi! Like you might have just noticed from that last sentence, this whole thing was first inspired by ‘Delicate’, but I kind of wanted to add some background context. Hope you like it, part three should be here tomorrow)

blog.name: swift-the-streets-i-used-to-own
blog.title: I could show you incredible things.
blog.description: Emily. Feeling 23. NSW Sydney Australia. Boomie and Sound Assist. Been a Swiftie since age 14, and no end in sight. Been to Speak Now, Red, 1989 and Reputation concerts ❤️❤️❤️. Some of the best times of my life have been with Taylor, even if she doesn't know it 😘 Instagram: emlayfish

summary: I just really fucking love Taylor Swift ok thanks for reading have a nice day
